title: Airdrop farming propelling growth in Ethereum layer-2 activity - Blockworks
summary: Ethereum layer-2 (L-2) activity has seen a significant increase since last quarter, with more than 20 separate networks built to improve scalability and efficiency. Airdrop farming is a key driver of this growth, with users performing certain actions to receive free tokens. The most active L-2 networks include zkSync, Polygon (zkEVM), and Optimism, with Stargate, a LayerZero bridge and airdrop candidate, having seven times more active users but only around half the volume of Uniswap. While some have suggested that airdrop hunting may account for a significant portion of L-2 volume, LayerZero CEO Bryan Pellegrino believes it is only around 54%.

title: Top Trader Predicts One Ethereum Rival Will Repeat Parabolic ETH Rallies of Past Cycle - The Daily Hodl
summary: Top trader predicts one Ethereum rival will repeat parabolic rallies of past cycle. Solana (SOL) is mirroring ETH's price action before a massive move to the upside. The trader expects SOL to repeat ETH's parabolic rally, as it did in the last cycle. Solana is trading at $25.23, up 8.7% in the last 24 hours. The trader also discusses the declining market cap of stablecoins, which indicates a decline in liquidity in the overall crypto markets. The market cap of stablecoins will likely increase when there is an approval of a spot Bitcoin ETF or the halving event expected in April of next year.

title: Top 3 Price Prediction Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple: BTC remains unbothered by Fed's diplomatic comments in FOMC - FXStreet
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Bitcoin (BTC) price maintains an overall uptrend despite Fed's FOMC decision, with critical support at $29,000. Ethereum (ETH) price faces resistance at $1,873, with indicators flashing bearish. Ripple (XRP) price encounters initial resistance at $0.7128, with possible pullback.

title: Linea Mainnet Appears on Metamask: What is it, and Why is it There? - NFT Plazas
summary: Linea Mainnet has been added to Metamask wallets as a new chain option due to its potential to alleviate congestion on the Ethereum network and reduce transaction costs. Linea is an Ethereum virtual machine compliant layer 2 scaling solution that uses zero knowledge roll up technology to perform tasks at greater speeds and lower fees. This new chain is the result of a collaboration between ConsenSys, the developer of Metamask, and aims to provide a more efficient and cost-effective way for users to interact with decentralized applications (dApps). By integrating with Ethereum, Linea can process transactions at a cost of approximately 15 times less than on the Ethereum mainnet, making it a promising solution for the future of the Ethereum network and NFTs.

title: Polygon (MATIC) Founder Predicts Future of Ethereum Ecosystem, Names Catalyst for Next 1,000,000,000 New Users - The Daily Hodl
summary: Polygon (MATIC) co-founder Sandeep Nailwal predicts that his project could represent the "endgame" for Ethereum infrastructure, with the potential to scale Web3 to 200-1 billion users. He believes that the current infrastructure war will end when applications take center stage in the crypto world, and that Polygon Labs' white paper outlining future transformations for the MATIC token aims to improve and rename it to POL, supercharging the growth of the network as it transitions to Polygon 2.0.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin below $29,500; Ethereum above $1,850; Solana rises 6%, Toncoin falls 4% - Business Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin and other cryptos rose after Fed raised interest rates by 25 basis points, but gains were capped. Bitcoin traded above $29,400, while Ethereum was at $1,870. Solana surged 6%, while other top tokens added 3-4%. XRP was the most traded altcoin, with a record $150 billion trading volume. Tech View expects Clover Finance to have a positive trajectory.

title: Whales Are Accumulating Ethereum, Avalanche, and Maker - CoinCodex
summary: Whales have been accumulating Ethereum, Avalanche, and Maker since the start of the year, with significant increases in whale holdings for all three coins. Top non-exchange addresses on the Ethereum network increased their supply from 24.8% to 30.3%, while the supply held by exchanges decreased. Avalanche whales have also been buying AVAX, with their stake increasing from 45.8% to 53.1% between January and June. Maker whales have increased their stake in the circulating supply from 46.7% to 49.9%. Crypto whales have been active during the market recovery, with the total crypto market cap increasing by $830 billion since the start of the year.

title: NFT-optimized Palm Network to become a Polygon ZK Supernet - Cointelegraph
summary: Palm Network, a nonfungible token (NFT)-focused blockchain, is set to become a customized Polygon (MATIC) ZK Supernet, making it more accessible to users while preserving security. The transition will occur in two stages, starting with a proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism network on August 23 and followed by a ZK-based layer-2 in 2024. Palm Network has partnered with NFT marketplace Candy Digital and digital art distributor HENI, and will become interoperable with Ethereum and the rest of the Polygon 2.0 ecosystem. This move is expected to increase accessibility for users without sacrificing security, as transfers between Palm Network and Ethereum will be processed using Polygon's zero-knowledge proof protocols.

title: Ethereum Layer 2 Rollup EthStorage Raised $7M in Seed Round - Crypto Times
summary: EthStorage, a layer 2 storage rollup on Ethereum, raised $7M in seed funding to scale the blockchain's storage capacity. The funding round was led by dao5 and included investors such as SevenX Ventures, Foresight Ventures, and Sky9 Capital. EthStorage aims to increase Ethereum's storage capacity from TB to PB levels using KZG commitment and Reed-Solomon code, and utilizes dynamic data sharding for data retention. The project differs from other L2 networks as it focuses on scaling Ethereum's storage capability.

title: Macro, Regulation, Staking ETH's State of Play - Real Vision
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum and crypto space are undergoing rapid changes, and Andrew Keys, co-founder of DARMA Capital, discusses regulatory landscape after Ripple/XRP ruling, staking, zero-knowledge proofs, and macro situation. Listeners are encouraged to send questions, suggestions, and feedback.

title: Winklevoss-Owned Gemini To Launch Trading Competition To Attract Users - Ethereum World News
summary: Gemini, a derivatives exchange founded by the Winklevoss twins, is launching a trading competition to attract new users. The competition will reward up to 250 GUSD to top-performing traders and will run from August 1 to August 31. The competition is open to users outside of the US, UK, and EU, and participants must fund their derivatives account with at least 250 GUSD before the end of the month. The competition comes as Gemini's trading volume has declined by over 87% in the past year.

title: Lacoste Unveils Exclusive Ethereum-Based Virtual Store For NFT Holders - NewsBTC
summary: Lacoste has launched an exclusive virtual store for NFT holders, offering a unique shopping experience through its partnership with Emperia. The virtual store integrates traditional retail with digital innovations, providing UNDW3 holders with an immersive experience. The store features a crocodile-themed scavenger hunt game, an underwater VIP space, and exclusive apparel collection available only to UNDW3 holders. This collaboration between Lacoste and Emperia is an example of the growing phygital trend in the fashion industry, where brands are leveraging Web3 technologies to create seamless connections between physical and digital retail experiences.

title: Shiba Inu Now Accounts For Almost 12% Of The Top Ethereum Whale Holdings | Bitcoinist.com - Bitcoinist
summary: Shiba Inu, a meme coin, has become one of the largest holdings among the top 100 Ethereum whales, accounting for almost 12% of their token holdings. This is despite the coin's recent fall in price and majority of holders being in loss. The data from WhaleStats shows that SHIB is the third-largest token holding for these whales, behind stablecoins USDC and USDT. However, the coin's price remains low and the majority of holders are in loss, indicating that the bear trend may continue.

title: Flashbots On Ethereum Becomes A Unicorn With $60 Million Series B Round | Bitcoinist.com - Bitcoinist
summary: Flashbots, an Ethereum-based software provider, has raised $60 million in a Series B funding round led by Paradigm, a popular venture capital firm. The funding round valued Flashbots at over $1 billion, making it a unicorn in the blockchain industry. The platform aims to reduce the impact of Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) bots by enhancing transactions and designing a more efficient and transparent blockchain ecosystem. The funding will be used to develop the platform's Single Unifying Auction for Value Expressions (SUAVE) and other intra-block applications. This round of funding is a significant shift towards Artificial Intelligence in the crypto space and highlights the growing interest in blockchain technology.

title: Ethereum or Bitcoin: What is a Better Investment Option? - PC Tech Magazine
summary: The article compares Ethereum and Bitcoin as investment options, highlighting their differences and similarities. Bitcoin is more decentralized and has more confidence from investors, with fewer hard forks in its history. Ethereum, on the other hand, is a multifunctional blockchain platform with more applications and higher transaction processing speed, but its supply of coins is unlimited and less stable in terms of price. The article suggests that both assets are suitable for long-term investment, but Ethereum may be cheaper and more profitable, making it a good option for diversifying risks.
